title: Quiz 2 - Probability
instruction:
Directions (46-50): Study the following table carefully and answer the given questions: The table shows people at a party shake hands  once with everyone else in the room and the ratio of the male to female in the party.

Room

Total number of hand shakes

Ratio of male to female

Number of persons whose age is above 40

Room 1

780

3:1

20

Room 2

1770

2:1

25

Room 3

1225

3:2

10

Room 4

190

3:1

5

Room 5

435

2:1

12

quiz.text: A bag contains 5 red balls and 7 blue balls. Two balls are drawn at random without replacement, and then find the probability of that one is red and other is blue.
options: 33/65
35/66
37/66
41/65
None of these

quiz.text: A bag contains 3 red balls and 8 blacks ball and another bag contains 5 red balls and 7 blacks balls, one ball is drawn at random from either of the bags, find the probability that the ball is red.
options: 93/264
95/264
91/264
97/264
None of these

options: None of these

quiz.text: There is a competition in billiards pool person should score 14 points to win the round 1. Every odd table players stroked 20% total balls and every even table players stroked 1 ball less than the average of odd table players. If every ball having 1 point means which table players stroked more balls (won)?
options: Table 1
Table 2
Table 3
Table 4
None of these

quiz.text: If the probability of selecting 1 Girl form group A is 7/20, find the probability of selecting 3 members from group A such that the out of three members one is Teacher, one is Boy and one is Girl.
